taskbody.context: To add new items to an existing snippets drawer:

step.cmd: Do one of the following choices:

row.entry: An empty item that you can edit
Right-click anywhere in an existing drawer, select Customize, and click NewNew Item .
Existing text pasted into a new item in an existing drawer
Copy or cut text to the clipboard. In the Snippets view, right-click anywhere in an existing drawer and click Paste.
Existing text pasted into a new item in a new or existing drawer
Select the text, right-click, click Add to Snippets, specify the name of the drawer in the Snippets view to which you want to add the item, and click OK.

step.cmd: Type a name for the new item, and, optionally, provide a description.
step.stepresult: The value that you type in the Name field will appear next to the item's icon in the Snippets view.

step.cmd: To include in the Template Pattern field a variable that you have already defined, click Insert Variable Placeholder.
step.info: A variable placeholder is a marker that, when tagging is inserted into the active file, will be replaced by the value that is entered into the Insert Template:Item_name dialog at insertion time. Clicking the Insert Variable Placeholder button or typing Ctrl+Space activates a pop-up in the text area that prompts you with the correct sequences to create a marker for the variable.
step.stepxmp: For example, if you create two variables named uri and prefix, and create variable placeholders for both, the template pattern might look like this:<%@ taglib uri="${uri}" prefix="${prefix}" %>

taskbody.result: The new item will be added to the list of items in the appropriate drawer.
